title: Complete aging in the noisy voter model enhances consensus formation
authors: Jaume Llabr\'es, Sara Oliver-Bonafoux, Celia Anteneodo, Ra\'ul Toral
abstract:
We investigate the effects of aging in the noisy voter model considering that
the probability to change states decays algebraically with age $\tau$, defined
as the time elapsed since adopting the current state. We study the complete
aging scenario, which incorporates aging to both mechanisms of interaction:
herding and idiosyncratic behavior, and compare it with the partial aging case,
where aging affects only the herding mechanism. Analytical mean-field equations
are derived, finding excellent agreement with agent-based simulations on a
complete graph. We observe that complete aging enhances consensus formation,
shifting the critical point to higher values compared to the partial aging
case. However, when the aging probability decays asymptotically to zero for
large $\tau$, a steady state is not always attained for complete aging.
